COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Students will cover large ground in applying game theory to economic and financial markets and interactions in a diverse set of examples like reputation, herding, bubbles and crashes, auctions, strategic information revelation and information accumulation in markets. COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Design synthesis of aero/hydro/mechanical systems; techniques of design; conceptual thinking; problem definition, configurational development, analytic engineering approximation, oral briefings and group problem solving. Graduate standing.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Stress Analysis. Linear Elasticity. Thin Plates. Finite Element Methods. Structural stability. Vibration of Continuous Systems. Emphasis on aerospace and aeronautical applications
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: A unified discussion of low-speed fluid mechanics including exact solutions; approximation techniques for low and high Reynolds numbers; inviscid flows; surface waves; dynamic stability; turbulence.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Response of flight to linear, nonlinear, and randomly defined disturbances. Generation and measurement of error signals in navigational systems. Stability and control techniques.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Generalized curvilinear coordinates; grid generation; numerical techniques for transonic and supersonic inviscid flows: boundary layer flows; reduced Navier-Stokes equations; compressible and incompressible viscous flows.  Recommended preparation: AME 511 or AME 530a.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Kinematics and kinetics of rigid body motion, quaternions; quaternions equations; elastic vibrations of continua; geometric and material nonlinearities; Galerkin methods; complex dynamical systems; computational methods.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Analysis of isothermal and nonisothermal boundary layers. Exact and approximate solutions of laminar and turbulent flows. Variable-property and high-speed effects; dimensional analysis. Recommended preparation: AME 331, AME 526
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_TITLE: Modeling and Control of Distributed Dynamic Systems
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Modeling and analysis of complex flexible mechanical systems; distributed transfer function synthesis; frequency-domain control methods; smart structure design; applications in vibration and noise control.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Phase plane, describing function, applications to mechanical and aerospace systems. Lyapunov stability theory. Popov theorem. Circle criterion. Lyapunov redesign. Sliding mode control. Backstepping. Passivity.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_TITLE: Survey of Energy and Power for a Sustainable Future
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Power production includes conventional fossil fuels, synthetic fuels, hydroelectric, solar, wind, geothermal, biomass and nuclear. The environmental consequences of various energy sources are discussed. Duplicates credit in CHE 510.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Andrew and Erna Viterbi School of Engineering

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Coordinate systems and transformations. Spherical trigonometry. Orientation angles. Spacecraft orbits and orbital maneuvers. Introduction to rocket propulsion, spacecraft attitude dynamics and control and space environment.

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Mathematical aspects of Machine Learning. PAC Learning, VC-dimension and complexity. Linear predictors (regression, perceptron, SVM). Convex learning and gradient descent. Neural networks and backpropagation.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Dana and David Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Evolution of mathematical ideas and techniques as seen through a study of the contributions of eminent mathematicians to the formulation and solution of celebrated problems.  Recommended preparation: upper division MATH course.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Formulation and study of models arising in population dynamics, growth of plankton, pollution of rivers, highway traffic, morphogenesis and tidal dynamics: stability, oscillations, bifurcations, chaos. The lab will consist of computer simulation of models using commercially available software.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Formulation and study of models arising in population dynamics, growth of plankton, pollution of rivers, highway traffic, morphogenesis and tidal dynamics: stability, oscillations, bifurcations, chaos. The lab will consist of computer simulation of models using commercially available software.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Polynomial rings, vector spaces, linear transformations, canonical forms, inner product spaces.  Recommended preparation: MATH 410.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_TITLE: Introduction to Theory of Complex Variables
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Complex numbers and functions.  Power series, analytic functions, harmonic functions.  Complex integration, Cauchy's theorem, Cauchy's formula.  Conformal mapping.  Applications in physics and engineering.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Dana and David Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Individual research and readings. Not available for graduate credit.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Dana and David Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Lectures on advanced material not covered in regularly scheduled courses. No more than two registrations allowed. Prerequisite: Departmental Approval.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Lectures directed to mathematics graduate students by faculty of the department and by outside speakers.  Problem solving workshops.  Graded CR/NC.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Linear equations and matrices, Gauss elimination, error estimates, iteration techniques; contractive mappings, Newton's method; matrix eigenvalue problems; least-squares approximation, Newton-Cotes and Gaussian quadratures; finite difference methods. Prerequisite: linear algebra and calculus.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Computational linear algebra; solution of general nonlinear systems of equations; approximation theory using functional analysis; numerical solution of ordinary and partial differential equations.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Markov processes in discrete or continuous time; renewal processes; martingales; brownian motion and diffusion theory; random walks, inventory models, population growth, queuing models, shot noise.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: a: Probability spaces; distributions and characteristic functions; laws of large numbers, central limit problems; stable and infinitely divisible laws; conditional distributions. Prerequisite: 525a or 570. b: Dependence, martingales, ergodic theorems, second-order random functions, harmonic analysi s, Markov processes.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: B: Commutative Algebra: Integrality, Hilbert Basis theorem, Hilbert Nullstellensatz; Modules: modules over PID's, chain conditions, tensor products; Noncommutative Rings: Jacobson radical, Artin-Wedderburn theorem, Maschke's theorem.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_TITLE: Financial Informatics and Simulation (Computer Labs and Prac
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Experimental laboratory trading for financial markets using double auctions: handling statistical packages for data analysis. Practical training in virtual market environments, using financial trading system software.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Dana and David Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences

COURSE_TITLE: Financial Informatics and Simulation (Computer Labs and Prac
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Experimental laboratory trading for financial markets using double auctions: handling statistical packages for data analysis. Practical training in virtual market environments, using financial trading system software.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Dana and David Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences

COURSE_TITLE: Financial Informatics and Simulation (Computer Labs and Prac
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Experimental laboratory trading for financial markets using double auctions: handling statistical packages for data analysis. Practical training in virtual market environments, using financial trading system software.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Dana and David Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Theory of analytic functions--power series and integral representations, calculus of residues, harmonic functions, normal families, approximation theorems, conformal mapping, analytical continuation.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: a: Measure and integration over abstract measure spaces, Radon-Nikodym theorem, Fubini's theorem, convergence theorems, differentiation. Prerequisite: 425ab. b: Metric spaces, contraction principle, category, Banach spaces, Riesz representation theorem, properties of Lp, Hilbert spaces, orthogonal expansions, Fourier series and transforms, convolutions. Prerequisite: 525a.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Advanced topics in stochastic analysis, asset pricing in continuous time, stochastic control, Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman equations, incomplete markets, American options, exotic options, term structure of interest rates. Duplicates credit in the former MATH-506.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Elementary theory of manifolds, Lie groups, homogeneous spaces, fiber bundles and connections. Riemannian manifolds, curvature and conjugate points, second fundamental form, other topics. Prerequisite: 440.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Walks in graphs, random walks, group actions on boolean algebras, Young diagrams and tableaux, the Matrix-Tree Theorem.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Dana and David Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Parametric families of distributions, sufficiency.  Estimation: methods of moments, maximum likelihood, unbiased estimation. Comparison of estimators, optimality, information inequality, asymptotic efficiency.  EM algorithm, jacknife and bootstrap.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Least squares estimation in the linear model, analysis of variance and covariance, F-test, multiple comparisons, multiple regression, selection of variables; introduction to experimental design.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Dana and David Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Transfer function models; stationary, nonstationary processes; moving average, autoregressive models; spectral analysis; estimation of mean, autocorrelation, spectrum; seasonal time series.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Dana and David Dornsife College of Letters, Arts and Sciences

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Second-order partial differential equations of elliptic, parabolic, and hyperbolic type; in particular, potential and wave equations.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Existence, uniqueness and continuation of solutions, differential inequalities, linear systems, Sturm-Liouville theory, boundary value problems, Poincare-Bendixson theory, periodic solutions, perturbations, stability, fixed point techniques.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Applications of the mathematical, statistical and computational sciences to data from molecular biology.     Algorithms for genomic sequence data: sequence and map assembly and alignment, RNA secondary structure, protein structure, gene-finding, and tree construction.  Recommended preparation: familiarity with the concepts of basic molecular biology as covered in BISC 320.
DEPTOWNERNAME: LAS - Natural Sciences & Mathematics

DEPTOWNERNAME: Ostrow School of Dentistry

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Application of occupational science evidence and occupational therapy principles of lifestyle and self-care behavior change to support self-analysis and integration of healthy habits and routines.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Ostrow School of Dentistry

Duplicates credit in former OT 504. Open only to Occupational Therapy maj ors.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Ostrow School of Dentistry

DEPTOWNERNAME: Ostrow School of Dentistry

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Part-time or full-time, practical work experience in the student's field of study. The internship must be located at an off-campus facility. DEPTOWNERNAME: Ostrow School of Dentistry

DEPTOWNERNAME: Ostrow School of Dentistry

DEPTOWNERNAME: Ostrow School of Dentistry

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Development of communicative proficiency and accuracy in Spanish within a therapeutic context. Introduction to Spanish language, adaptive communication strategies, and ethics in language-discordant communication.

COURSE_TITLE: Advanced Pharmacology of Anesthesia Practice I
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic principles, uptake and distribution of inhalational anesthetics, and pharmacology of respiratory and cardiovascular drugs. Application of pharmacologic principles to anesthetic management.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Keck School of Medicine

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Basic theory of anesthesia administration, preanesthetic assessment, physical examination, monitoring. Case management including airway and blood/fluid management, anesthesia machine, and postoperative pain. Lecture/case study format.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Keck School of Medicine

COURSE_TITLE: Professional Integration to the Clinical Environment
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Correlation of techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory in the clinical environment with observation and supervised clinical instruction.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Keck School of Medicine

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Focuses on positive/protective social and behavioral factors influencing well-being of individuals and populations. Public health promotion strategies, clinical prevention and lifestyle choices will be reviewed.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Keck School of Medicine

COURSE_TITLE: Advanced Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia I
INSTRUCTOR_NAME: Bamgbose, Elizabeth, Blu;Darna, Jeffrey;McCall, Erica;Hogan, Jennifer, L.;Gold, Michele, E.;Norris, Teresa, E.
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Correlating techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory expanded to geriatric, obstetrical, and pediatric anesthesia; anesthetic management includes medically compromised patients.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Keck School of Medicine

COURSE_TITLE: Advanced Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia II
INSTRUCTOR_NAME: Bamgbose, Elizabeth, Blu;Darna, Jeffrey;McCall, Erica;Hogan, Jennifer, L.;Gold, Michele, E.;Norris, Teresa, E.
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Correlation of techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory expanded to neuroanesthesia, cardiac anesthesia, trauma anesthesia, critical care and pain management.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Keck School of Medicine

COURSE_TITLE: Advanced Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia III
INSTRUCTOR_NAME: Bamgbose, Elizabeth, Blu;Darna, Jeffrey;McCall, Erica;Hogan, Jennifer, L.;Gold, Michele, E.;Norris, Teresa, E.
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Correlation of techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory expanded to neuroanesthesia, cardiac anesthesia, trauma anesthesia, critical care and pain management.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Keck School of Medicine

COURSE_TITLE: Advanced Clinical Residency in Nurse Anesthesia IV
INSTRUCTOR_NAME: Bamgbose, Elizabeth, Blu;Darna, Jeffrey;McCall, Erica;Hogan, Jennifer, L.;Gold, Michele, E.;Norris, Teresa, E.
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Correlation of techniques of anesthesia administration with application of scientific and pharmacologic theory expanded to neuroanesthesia, cardiac anesthesia, trauma anesthesia, critical care and pain management.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Keck School of Medicine

COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Part two of a four-semester curriculum promoting synthesis and mastery of topics integral to the art and science of nurse anesthesia planning, management and delivery.
DEPTOWNERNAME: Keck School of Medicine

COURSE_TITLE: Teaching Analytical Writing through Readings in the Humanities
COURSE_DESCRIPTION: Theories and practices in university-level teaching of close-reading and analytical writing, using texts central to Western tradition.  Graduate student professionalization throught topical workshops and discussions.  Open to assistant lecturers and teaching assistants only.  Graded CR/NC.
